intro: Galium koreanum, commonly known as Korean bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to East Asia, particularly Korea and parts of China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium koreanum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
